intro: Sphaeranthus cufodontii, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers surrounded by white ray florets. It typically grows in open grasslands and is often found in disturbed soils. Sphaeranthus cufodontii is adapted to arid conditions and is drought-resistant.
